samples.name: Illite grain coating
samples.description: This card compares a BSE (left) and QEMSCAN (right) view of a rock sample. The BSE image shows compositional contrast and grain textures, while the QEMSCAN map identifies minerals: pink areas represent quartz, and lime-green areas show illite forming grain coatings along quartz surfaces. This highlights the distribution of illite coatings, which can affect reservoir quality and fluid interactions.
samples.reference: Bello, A. M., Al-Ramadan, K., Babalola, L. O., Alqubalee, A., & Amao, A. O. (2023). Impact of grain-coating illite in preventing quartz cementation: Example from permo-carboniferous sandstone, Central Saudi Arabia. Marine and Petroleum Geology, 149, 106073.

samples.name: Pyrite-bearing sandstone
samples.description: This stereo image shows pyrite (golden grains) distributed within a sandstone. Pyrite occurs as fine to medium grains, clustered along grain boundaries and pore spaces.
samples.reference: Alqubalee, A., Abdullatif, O., Babalola, L., & Makkawi, M. (2019).
